intro: Hieracium chomatophilum, commonly known as the mountain hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in summer, and the plant is known for its hairy stems and lobed leaves. Hieracium chomatophilum is often found in meadows and rocky areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
